revised_title: Fossil Flora and Coalfield Relationships in the Forest of Dean, Gloucestershire
tldr: This study examines the fossil flora of the Forest of Dean coalfield in Gloucestershire and compares it to other coalfields in the West of England and South Wales. The research reveals a complex relationship between these coalfields, with differences in their geological history and floral composition. The findings suggest that local variations in the distribution of flora during the Carboniferous period played a significant role in shaping these coalfields.
